body.name: Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Industrial Grade, Easy Change Steelhead for Wet Mop with Wooden Handle, Floor Cleaning, 60 Inch
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery March 4 - 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Side Gate Handle's thumb wheel clamps the mop firmly in place.
Hardwood handle is sturdy and long-lasting.
Should be used with 1 -inch headband mops only.
65 inches long by 2.25 inches wide by 2.167 inches high. 2.333 pounds. Made in the USA.
body.description: The Rubbermaid Commercial Invader Wet Mop Handle makes removing and replacing floor mop heads easy and efficient. 60 inches long, the hardwood handle has a good strength-to-weight ratio, corrosion resistance and a yellow plastic side gate style connection for use with a wet mop with a 1-inch headbands (sold separately). A floor mop headband can slide into the side gate, and then be tightened with the thumb wheel for a firm connection between the mop stick and mop head. This mop handle is suitable for use in commercial and industrial applications.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I used these working offshore on the boat, I ordered one from my home, and I don’t regret it one bit
reviews.reviewText: I am so impressed with the price of this mop. Every single mop I’ve bought from Walmart or the dollar stores in the last five years has broken within two months. It’s an evitable. I wanted to try something industrial that I have used personally. You will not believe how good of a price they have on these here and the quality is not even worth talking about it. There is no competition. It’s impressive, truly. Just buy it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and long lasting.
reviews.reviewText: Great handles and they stand up to commercial use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better than plastic
reviews.reviewText: I recently bought a hollow plastic mop, a supposedly high rated one, it folded in the first 30 minutes of use - broken. So I went back to wood. This is a great mop, easy to use and cheap but it too was just a tad bit too flimsy. I managed to crack it in first 2 hours of use. I duct taped it and am still using it. For the money its better than hollow plastic but should be a little thicker and sturdier for GUYS THAT MOP HARD.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smell Mop who?
reviews.reviewText: Where do I start to describe the joy, ease and beauty of this under-praised utility devise? Once your mop is installed on the metal end, you can mop while standing up - no more sloshing the mop around by hand. What's better, you can now dip the mop into the squeeze chamber without getting your arms and hands trapped. This stick is amazing and I wish I'd thought of it sooner! Thank you stick maker!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent heavy-duty mop.....
reviews.reviewText: This is an old-fashioned, heavy-duty mop handle, used with the Rubbermaid heavy-duty string mop head. I've tried so many mops, and finally invested in this, the "real" thing. Work is so much faster, and mop head is easy to wash.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good replacement handle, but doesn't hold up to heavy-duty use
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this to replace a metal handle that snapped. I hoped wood would be more sturdy, but this doesn't feel like it's going to last any longer than the metal handle it replaced. I can feel the wood flexing when I need to really put in some elbow grease on a tough-to-remove spot. The handle really needs to be at least a quarter inch thicker in diameter so it has more rigidity. However, if you are looking for a lightweight, light duty, handle this will do the job. I would prefer something heavier, intended for commercial use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Not for Commercial use in shop, handle not thick enough. They will work well in Stores

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Just too thin
reviews.reviewText: I bought this along with the Rubbermaid Commercial Wavebrake Mopping System Bucket and Side Press Wringer (35 gallons), and the matching Red Dirty Water Bucket (18 qt. capacity). It's a great set-up for use in my basement, or anywhere. But this mop handle is just too thin. The worst is not the flex, but that your hands get fatigued after a short time using it.I do not have very large hands, and I'd imagine the problem would be even worse for those who do. It is a lot like trying to turn screws with a screwdriver handle that is too thin. Mopping is a fairly vigorous activity. You need more grip to have proper control, and this handle does not afford it. The 0.94" (15/16") thickness is just too little.I replaced it with a proper mop handle from the local family-owned hardware store. It is the standard 1.25" thick (actually 1-3/16"). That extra quarter inch of diameter makes all the difference. It's also made of a nicely varnished Indonesian hardwood and gives that sturdy feel and ease of use that you need. And it cost less than a dollar more than this item. The head is also made of thicker steel, is 1" longer, and all around sturdier.I prefer buying online, especially with the Covid pandemic raging. At the hardware store checkout counter, a fool was standing less than 3 feet behind me. When I looked closely, I saw his mask was pulled down so it did not cover his nose. I avoid challenging such people, because it can so easily lead to violence, but I did ask him to give me a little more space at the counter. He backed up about 6 inches. This is why I buy online whenever I can. But avoid this mop handle.
not suitable for commercial use as handle is too thin
